bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to L. O. Howard, March 22, 1922

div1.p: LePrince sends six mosquitoes hatched from pupae found in the hotel in Carbondale, Illinois.

div1.head: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to L. O. Howard, March 22, 1922
div1.opener:
F. I. - Malaria
Room 17, Court House
Book Le P.
JC
HEADQUARTERS:
Field Investigations of Malaria
U.S. Public Health Service,
Memphis, Tenn.
March 22, 1922.
Dr. L. O. Howard, Chief,
Bureau of Entomology,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Howard:
div1.p:
Regarding the prevalence of Stegomyia in
Hotel Roberts, Carbondale, Illinois, during January,
already reported to you, and of the specimens taken
there in February 1922, additional information is
now available.

In March, 1922, Mr. E. H. Gage, Sanitary
Engineer, U.S.P.H.S., was in Carbondale. On March
15th he searched for breeding places in Hotel Roberts
and in the writing room in one of the containers in
which the flower pots are kept he found mosquito
larvae and pupae. He brought these to me on March
18th and on March 19th and 20th, 1922, six of the
pupae emerged - some of the collection have not yet
emerged.

I am mailing you today the six that emerged.
They are in a small grey box packed in cotton. The
lid of the box is marked, and also there is a pencil
note inside signed by me.
div1.closer:
With best wishes, I am
Sincerely yours, J. A. LePrince J. A. LePrince,
Senior Sanitary Engineer.
cc: Dr. H. R. Carter.
FOR YOUR INFORMATION
